text: I agree with Philip M. It is truly a hidden gem. We came because IHOP was too crowded and Denny's was being remodeled... Their lost!! But I can only comment on breakfast... It's just the way mom used to make it!! The bacon was fried just the way I like it, over easy eggs good, and the pancakes, oh the pancakes...I can see myself driving right pass IHOP and Denny's again in the future... We're heading to Harvest Cafe!! I wonder if it's family owned?
I've enjoyed many a 'last minute' out to dinner at Harvest Cafe in the past 3 years. The Tilapia dinner is always tasty as are the Steak or Chicken Caesar salads.

This place is great. Their breakfast is always on point and its only 4.99 plus tax which equals to about $5.39 their service is fast if you know what you want and you honestly can't beat their $4.99 deal three buttermilk pancakes two eggs and two slices of bacon that is better than any I hop.

I'm going to avoid all the superfluous stuff. Breakfast standards pancakes, french toast, skillets. Tasty sausage and bacon. Reasonable pricing. Staff is efficient and friendly without being overly friendly. Overall really good food fast and fresh. What more can you ask for?

I have only been here for breakfast( they serve it all day). This place could use a little more of an update inside,but it's always clean.This is a gem! This is a family owned business with homemade food.The breakfast burritos are the best I have ever had.The prices are also very affordable.I think I spent around 9 dollars for my breakfast
Stopped for breakfast and the service good. Breakfast sucks. Eggs burned pancakes hard. Never been to a place that you needed a knife to cut your pancakes. Will not be coming back anytime soon.
Tilapia is on point here French fries are nice and crispy  kids enjoyed their chicken strips very fresh and juicy. We'll definitely visit again also kids eat free with purchase of adult entree!
Had 2/1 coupon. Breakfast has good. Will come back if I get another coupon.... bathroom smelled like cat pee

What a complete and utter disappointment. I thought this would be a quaint mom and pop restaurant, I was wrong. 

We got there and it was seat yourself. No biggie. We sat down and a lady brought 3 menus (there were 4 of us). They took our drink order. When they came back with the drinks we tried to order our appetizer but we were told that the waitress would be with us shortly. Then a male arrived at the table so we placed our appetizer order. Then another female came to take our order. It took at least 45 minutes between sitting down and ordering. Our food then took another 45 minutes to be prepared. Our appetizer tasted like the frozen ones from Costco and was a mess. My husbands pot roast sandwich lacked flavor, my mother in law had to ask for extra condiments to give her frisco burger flavor. My daughters bacon was burnt while her eggs were under cooked. Finally my burger was just so so. I only ate half and gave the other half to my husband since he refused to eat his food. 

We ended up taking the food home to the animals.
Been there few times they have good food but kinda pricey for the place. They need to drop prices

If your are looking for a breakfast place that is somewhat plain, but easily accessible with good food, this is a place to go. When searching I expected a place with "Harvest" in its name to trend toward health food and grains.  But this is a good solid place.  

My wife had the Harvest Omelet which had mushrooms, peppers, onions, tomatoes and spinach.  No meat but they have meat omelets as well. She really enjoyed it.  I had the Bacon or Sausage Skillet with the sausage option.  In addition to the main ingredients there were two over easy (my choice) eggs on top.  Being gluten intolerant all I missed was the toast, no biggie.  

The servings were generous and neither of us could finish our meals, although I did cherry-pick the sausage pieces our of my remnant portion making it unsuitable for a take-away box. Their menu which is posted on line is extensive and should have something for everybody who wants a hearty breakfast. 

The service was prompt and courteous.  When we arrived (late again) it was seat yourself so we had no trouble getting in.  They had filled up pretty well by the time we left, but it doesn't seem to be a place that typically has long waiting lines - something we really appreciate as my wife has knee issues.  

The decor is somewhat plain, but if you are looking for a place for good food at a reasonable price and not an art gallery this is the place.

Hubby& I went to there for breakfast. The place was clean, & food was very good, as was the service. Hot coffee, he had taco omlette,  & I had ham steak& eggs, it was good size portion, not to big, and the eggs  &hashbrowns were perfect. His toast that came with his breakfast was done just right not burned at all just lightly browned as was the rest of his breakfast. We will be back. (Sorry Dennys & Stacks & Yolks YUCK)
When here for breakfast! I ordered the stuffed French toast topped with strawberries! I tasted delicious! You could really taste the freshness. Our serve was great excellent service!

Excellent service and excellent food! Definitely will be going back!  I live in North Las Vegas and there are not too many breakfast joints near my house. I was surprised when I found this "hole in the wall."  It definitely has a cafe look, but is very clean.  It's my understanding the place if family owned, and all the employees were friendly.  The food was fresh, came out in a reasonable time, and tasted delicious.  Chicken fried steak was bomb and eggs benedict was acceptable.  I willl try for dinner or lunch next.

Ive been here several times, the first time by accident since it is a little hidden, breakfast was delicious, I got the Ranchero Eggs. 

Customer Service was great, very friendly staff and very attentive to your needs. They make you feel very comfortable 

I highly recommend this place :)

Coffee is really good too!

9am on a Saturday morning, my 9 year old daughter and I walked into harvest cafe to try out their breakfast.
The staff was extremely efficient and very accommodating towards my daughters love of bacon, substituting ALL the sides that came with the French toast to ONLY BACON with no issues :)
I ordered the country steak and over medium eggs, the most perfectly cooked eggs I think I may have ever had in a breakfast establishment, my steak was juicy & crisp, the sausage gravy could of used a little more seasoning.
Wish they had some more unique menu items, but thinking they cater to the 'older' patrons that were seated in the restaurant.

We will definitely be back!
I love this place, great service. I will miss it...... the waitresses are fabulous.  Awesome food . The chorizo burritos are bomb ...... . I am going to miss it .

We have driven past his place for years and never been in. I was surprised at how large it is inside. Breakfast was great: pancakes fluffy, eggs cooked perfect, bacon crispy... The service was fast and friendly. I would definitely eat here again.

Seriously do you guys even want a tip, can't tell if you didn't like me or jus don't care about your job. Older Hispanic waiter and younger girl gave the worst service, no refills, I asked for ranch and they jus forgot about it. Do you care about your costumers? Or even your business? I tried giving you guys a second chance, you guys messed that up..

Every time we come here it feels like s small town cafe. The food has a home made feel n taste n is always good. The staff are the nicest n very polite. The prices are good n seldom crowded. A hidden family gem.

Very good neighborhood cafe. Seemed like a lot of locals. Staff was friendly and made you feel like a local even when I wasn't. You want big flashy go somewhere else. You want friendly good home style cooked meal this is the place
I love this place my husband and i eat here at least once a week. It very cozy. Fast and polite service Good food. What more could you want.
Good food and company. Staff is friendly and attentive. Quick service even with our party of 6.

I decided to try this place for lunch. I will definitely not be returning, nor can I recommend it to anyone else.

The portion size was incredibly small for the price. I could have let that slide if the food had been excellent, but it was not. My "ultimate" sandwich was a dried-out chicken breast with a couple slices of avocado. The french fries were OK, but definitely nothing to rave about.

The low point came when I had to use the restroom. It looked as if it hadn't been cleaned in a month. There were even dead and dying roaches on the floor. On the way back to my table, I glanced in the kitchen and it looked nearly as dirty as the restroom. I wish I had seen these things before eating -- I would have left before ordering.

So my friend told me about this place and I must say it was really good I had the chicken Parmesan very tasty my honey had chicken gravy he loved it and we had a salad the ranch was AMAZING!! GOOD SPOT!

This was a pleasant, unexpected breakfast stop for me. I needed to kill some time while my car was being fixed across the street. The deco is in need of some help. It's a bit confusing, nothing related to harvest. The walls can't decide on a theme. 

My nephew and I enjoyed a good meal at a reasonable price. He had the bacon cheeseburger and I have the bacon avocado omellete (a generous amount of bacon). We both substituted the sides. I opted for green beans and oh my, they were delicious!! 

The coffee on the other hand was a total disappointment.  It left me yearning for a double espresso!

Very disappointedthis was our first and last time here. My son's food had a long gross hair so we notified the waitress and offered to remake the order. My son said he wanted it to go because we had to leave. When we got home we looked at the food and we were even more disappointed  his original order had poached eggs and what they gave us was hard boiled

It was just ok. I needed a break from the typical fast food place and ran into this spot. It's barely noticeable from the parking lot and is next door to a dry cleaners. The interior was very clean, but horribly outdated. I was expecting oranges and yellows with deep pomegranate colors, but instead found back metal and emerald green. 

The food was a tad more expensive than Dennys or iHop and moderately appetizing. There was only one waitress and another gentleman who appeared to be a waiter/cook/bus-boy. 

There was one older couple when we arrived and a family of four walked in when I did. It was the first time both myself and that family of four had ever been there and I suspect it'll be the last for both as well.
The service was great but my meal was just 'meh' . It could very well be what I ordered...a veggie burger. The fries that came with it were VERY good! #theregoesmydiet ;-)

Harvest cafe is very close to my business. I have had many customers ask where to get a bite to eat. I am a person that doesn't like to recommend places. I am afraid it may reflect poorly on oneself. This is not the case with the Harvest Cafe. I have sent at least 50 or more customers there in the last 2 years. Every time they return and thank me for sending them to it. The food is great, service excellent and friendly. Many people also have been very appreciative of the reasonable pricing as well. It is and pleasure to send someone to a place like this. My own personal experience has been great food and service, the price has never mattered to me, so I honestly would pay twice that for the this place. What I especially like the best, is the friendly home town ambiance you get while eating. I also have always noticed the other  guests seem to be enjoying themselves as well.
This is my go to spot for omelettes. They stack it! Couple times a week. Great after a night out too . good service and portions are right. atmosphere and lighting, cleanliness are the deductions.

Second time having breakfast here. The food is good, well priced and service is very good. This place is no nonsense no frills but just plain good all the way around. I suggest you try the weekday breakfast specials $5.99 for bacon, eggs and pancakes good food and great prices
Great food and service! Lots of food for the money and the customer service is off the charts. Great neighborhood restaurant.
Great food good pricing diffently a hidden gem. Staff is polite and courteous. It is a nice quiet atmosphere with friendly faces all over.
Great family and food the owner and his wife are the nicest people go in and you will see. Thanks for working with me.
This is a family owned business and they make almost everything from scratch.The breakfast burritos were the best I ever had.Prices are also very reasonable.The place could use an update though
This is our favorite family restaurant. My husband and I go almost every weekend. The food is always good and the staff friendly. We have never been disappointed.

So I found this place here on yelp after looking up huevos rancheros & walking out of another place for not having them (lulu's) & I was very pleasantly surprised, the place was clean, bathroom included, it's a decent size & everyone is not bunched up in the middle. The service was good, friendly waitresses & the bus boy was helpful & on it. The menu has a lot of variety & turkey sausage which is a big plus. My huevos rancheros were soooo good, it had 2 fried tortillas on the bottom, refried beans, plenty of cheese, eggs over hard & salsa on top, the tortilla strips & avocado were a perfect finish. The potatoes on the side were perfect too & it can also be ordered w/ur choice of meat. The pancakes were also deliciously light & fluffy & in my opinion better than other chain restaurants. We'll definitely be back.

This review is based on the time we went, but if I had to come here again, it would probably be better. But since its the first time I ever came to this restaurant, I'll give it a decent review. 

Located on Craig and Decatur, next to a discount mall. It's a small restaurant, which is in a decent location. it was early morning that we went, and Sunday for that matter. There was 8 of us, and we were able to get a good seating. It did fill up really fast, which shows that, they are a very recognized place. But knowing that they had guess coming in big crowd, it did show that they had little room to accommodate the guess. In other words, the place was small for the popularity they have. 

The staff, were nice and very helpful. But when they got busy, it seems like the wait time for service tend to spread out more and it seem like they were under staff. It was kind of hard to get refills, or get attention. I think I finished my food, before I got a refill on my drink. But they did what they can do, in which, I'll give them credit for doing what they can. 

The food, on the other hand, was great. I had the steak and eggs, which was cooked very well and presented very well I basically inhaled it. We also had the chicken quesadilla for appetizer, which was full of chicken. The wife loved it, but I wasn't fond of the sour cream being in a packet. But the quesadilla was good, I'll give them that. 

Not fond of the fact that they only had one of those bathroom, just for one person at a time. Mainly end up having to stay in line, just to use a bathroom. Other then that, the place can be better, but the food was great. 

I would probably recommend this place for the food. Probably go there when its not so busy and that you don't plan to use the bathroom while you're their. Other then that, its an A-OK kind of review. Maybe next time, it will be better.

Ok, we have been here years ago, but I don't remember it being this good. Otherwise I would have been back much sooner. 
I had the huavos rancheros and My wife had the chicken fried steak. Both were hot and delicious. The chicken fried steak is made onsite as are the home fries and the refried beans. It was all sooooo goood! 
We'll be back soon.

They serve breakfast all day, which scores big points with me.  The restaurant is clean, the waitress was very friendly as were other patrons.  I have the steak and eggs and everything tastes fresh.  I did see that they have a $4.99 breakfast special until 2pm - but I honestly didn't see what that included, sorry, but for $5 at a sit down restaurant where your food is fresh and made to order, who cares, right?  Lol. I'll be back!!

First time trying this cafe.  The food was a great value - lots of food and a fair price.  My husband had the pot roast omelet and I had the spinach/mushroom omelet.  The service was lacking.  We sat at one table for 10 minutes but were not even given a menu.  After seeing two other groups come in after us and be waited on before us, we moved to another table...that was better but still coffee was not refilled and we had to flag down a waitress just to get the check.  We would go again but only if we had lots of time and didn't mind sitting around waiting.
This place has the best fries!  I love the chicken club. It has avocado, yum! The breakfasts are big n delicious. Really everything is good. The waitresses are so nice.

Such a disappointment,  we went in and they told us to sit anywhere. So, we did.  We sat in a booth on the right side of the restaurant.  There was approximately 5 tables and 2 booths with couples in them. There were two food servers working. We sat there 20 minutes, before we were even given a menu,  another 10 minutes before our server came back to take our drink order. Then when we finally got to order our food it took 30 minutes!  We will NEVER return to this place again!

This is my second time visiting this place but this one was a Togo order. 

I sat and drank coffee while I waited for my order. 

Decor: 
None! This place need a major face lift. I walk into this place and immediately feel dirty. Dingy, stagnant and dark come to mind. The carpet looks so dirty, the chairs are awful. Esthetically this place looks like they got started with ideas and then checked their bank account and got an allowance to the 99 cent store. This place really needs a major overhaul and TLC. 

Food:
I had the pot roast sandwich and fries. I also ordered a full chef salad to go with avocado. 

The salad was blah. It had maybe half a boiled egg, less than an ounce of turkey and ham combined. The avocado side I got was just literally one slice cut in half to appear bigger and brown,Wth?! Tomatoes where so soggy it was disgusting. 




 The positive side 

Fries are so good! Crispy, perfectly seasoned, ranch dressing is great. The pot roast sandwich was good needed a little bit more salt but that's easily fixed. 

I really hope the owners give this place the much TLC it needs.
Pretty good breakfast place if your looking for something nice and fast.  I had the breakfast special.  Eggs, bacon and French toast.

We really love going to Harvest Cafe. The food is wonderful, the prices are great, and the staff is so friendly. It's run by family and it has a friendly family atmosphere. There are a lot of regulars that go there and they are always getting new - regulars. Breakfast and lunch are my favorites and Monday through Friday the have great specials on them. Give it a try if you want a home style meal in a nice place!!!!

My husband and I had breakfast here. It was good food, clean atmosphere. Prices resonsible and  short wait time for the food and check. Waitress was pleasent. We enjoyed our visit and will be visiting again. It is a small business but worth a visit.
This is our go-to place every weekend! the staff is always so wonderful and welcoming and the food is delicious! The huevos rancheros are delicious!! I recommend this to everyone I know.

Been going here for 10 years. Great food, friendly staff. It is a local legend in our area of town. Mauricio and Karena are the owners and Mauricio is also the head chef. Karena is a fixture out front, always smiling and always making sure everything is running well. There is a variety of food and all well done. Breakfast is awesome, Salads are awesome, and the cheese burgers to die for. Carmen is our favorite waitress. She is not only a great server, but you will end up thinking she is an old friend.
Great food and service, I really wish I could give more stars but the image of this place sucks. Looks like you're in an old rancid cafeteria. Their floor mats are trash and i almost tripped on one.

I want to like this place so much. We've had breakfast and dinner here. I think breakfast is the way to go. The biscuits and gravy is amazing. My wife is particular with her gravy, she's a Tennessee girl, and she loved it. I've had the two egged breakfast with bacon and hash browns. My father-in-law had the breakfast chicken fried steak. So I decided the have the dinner chicken fried steak since his looked so good. The gravy they serve at night is completely different from the one they served in the morning. It had a more yellow color to it, not white with pepper.  The wife had fried chicken this time, it's was good not outstanding. We'll definitely be back, just for breakfast though.

My in-laws brought me here for breakfast because they wanted me to try it out. First off the menu is pretty cheap and the food we ordered was okay, nothing special. 

There seemed to be only 1 waiter and he was helpful. I wasn't too keen on the lack of decor and ambience of the place. It kinda looks like this space use to be an office and it's just weird all together.

In general I wouldn't really come again because I know I can get better breakfast elsewhere with better service and a more inviting atmosphere. 

I'd say Harvest Cafe has a long way to go to become a real restaurant. There's just way too many details that are missing from this place but I wish them all the best.

Defiantly a small hole in the wall. Pretty basic restaurant cafe. Friendly staff. Really no different from Denny's or ihop considering, just a bit more flavoring. My husband had their special, top sirloin & he liked it, steak could have used more seasoning, but most places we eat (outback with exception) does not flavor their steaks for some reason. I had their huevos rancheros & it was yummy, the salsa used was chopped finely (which I love) the salsa was just right for the hotness. Had crunchy flour tortilla chips. Overall, not bad! Places was very clean, I'm very picky person! I watched the staff wipe all the silverware down, coffee caffe was clean as well(maybe due to one of the reviews, but that is good)

Awesome place! Great tasting, quality food and great service. My boyfriend orders the steak and eggs and loves it, I always get pancakes or the waffle special, both are very good and you can tell that the batter is made fresh. Karina has waited on us several times now and she is great, friendly and prompt service. We will be back!
Had the signature breakfast sandwich and added avocado. It was the best sandwich I have ever had. The blend of flavor a was to die for. I would give 10 stars if I could!!!!
We love the friendly atmosphere and great food. The prices are good and they have a good amount of options for any type of eater.

Stop in Sat for lunch. Kids wanted burgers, dad breakfast and mom something else. French toast, sausage, egg was very good. Cooked perfectly.  Chicken fried steak and potatoes were also very good.  Kids got adult burgers and fries. Fries were very good. Kids liked the burgers, I thought the burgers were just ok. Atmosphere was classic cafe  style. Not what you would expect in a strip mall. Service excellent.  Better coffee then most. I would recommend Harvest cafe!

My wife have been there many times. The food just keeps getting worse. We had steaks tonight one was okay but the other was 80% fat and gristle. The part I was able to cut out was was so tough I could not eat it. The salad was old and bitter. There is no pride in there food anymore. We will never go back for lunch or dinner.

When my husband and I went, there was practically no one there, yet it still took forever for our food to get to us. They didn't bring one of our orders but didn't charge us either. When we did get our food it was just eh.

Amazing food, excellent service, very friendly staff, environment is comforting and it reminds me of back home in Hawaii, a lot of Aloha in the air and would definitely recommend coming here for any occasion

I come here a few times a month since I stumbled on it.  It reminds me of restaurants back home, family ordinated and always a friendly atmosphere 
It's kid friendly too.  They have a nice menu and breakfast all day, never have been disappointed

The service and food were average.   While we were there several customers came and went.  Since it was not busy it was rather quiet.   The food is okay.   Basically,  if you don't want to cook at home this would be an alternative.   I had the Philly cheese steak, my spouse a burger.   It was definitely diner food.   We don't plan on returning.  The service was okay as well.   Nice ladies.

My Mom goes for the Liver and Onions with her 85 year old friend and I was invited to tag along and have wanted to try it out. The description, American Traditional is perfect because that is what it is. You want meat loaf, spaghetti, fried chicken it is all here in its glory. Do not expect nouvelle cuisine, it is geared for an older crowd.

Speaking of older crowd, it is like dining at a retirement home. I am old and I was the youngest. If you want to bring someone older out to dinner this is where you take them. My burger came out to $10 so it is not cheap, but wait a minute, USE THE COUPON and you are good! 

The decor is very nice in there, I was very surprised. I did not check out the bathroom because that is my new check that I am adding to my reviews, a clean bathroom = clean kitchen. The service was a little slow, the place was packed with two servers and a busser and they were all friendly.

Remember, American Traditional, bring your coupon and it is a great deal. PS Older people eat early, so get there before 4:30 and order your food!
It was good. Sausage gravy was nothing to write home about. Shredded hashbrowns were yummy crispy! Waffle was good!

My husband and I went there for dinner. The menu is pretty decent for your choices. My husband had fish and chips (cod) and I had chicken alfredo. The cod was great, and I don't even like fish. My chicken alfredo was really good, just a little too thick and creamy. So it's good for someone who's really hungry and wants a filling dish. The prices are great, and the service is also. I recommend this place for anyone who's looking for a good meal for a great price. We will be going back for breakfast sometime soon.
Awesome service and great food definitely coming back hash browns are some of the best in town
Cute little place in north Las Vegas. We got the pancakes and eggs and ham and eggs. Both were cooked just right. Pancakes were nice and fluffy. Nothing special but it's classic food done right.

Came in for breakfast. We didn't even realize this place was here. Quiet and cozy atmosphere. My hubby was happy they had a big screen tv across from our table. He ordered country fried steak and eggs and I got corned beef hash and eggs. Their gravy is really nice. Not sure I would order corned beef again as it comes from a can. Really prefer homemade. It was still good though. My hubby's fried steak was huge. He couldn't finish his breakfast. We will be back again to try other items off the menu.

Was hungry for breakfast food and found this place was near where we needed to go afterwards. It's definitely dated and a little dingy inside, a typical mom and pop type of restaurant. 

We ordered the French toast breakfast with sausage, bacon, and scrambled eggs and the corned beef hash plate with home fries and over easy eggs. The French toast plate had 4 fairly large pieces of French toast but size didn't make up for flavor. The French toast was bland, with no hints of cinnamon or vanilla...or anything, really. Bacon and sausage were standard and the eggs were cooked nicely. The corned beef hash had a nice crispy outside and tasted ok. Could definitely tell it was from a can and not homemade. Home fries and over easy egg were done right. 

Pricing was ok for the portions, food came out quickly, and service was ok. Probably won't come back, though.

We love this place! We come here a lot and they just keep getting better! New decor, same food, great friendly service! You cant go wrong! We proudly support this mom and pop shop! Grilled chicken caesar salad was amazing and my son love their spaghetti.
Good home cooking.  Great service.  Positive atmosphere. Nice little tucked away place
Good prices, good service.  Great to have an easy to get to local diner.

Ordered the Veggie Burger for take out, and it was really nothing to brag about, the whole presentation was pretty boring. I figured something called the 'Harvest Cafe' who brags about 'fresh ingredients',  would know a thing or two about making a 'vegetarian' burger, but I was wrong. First off, the menu says that it comes with sprouts (which was what I was really looking forward to), but it just ended up coming with iceberg lettuce (which I can't stand Iceberg). Also, the patty was really thin and dry ( I could have just thrown a Morning Star patty in the microwave and got the same results) and the bread was really thick for such a little patty. Even the avocado was dry, if that makes sense. Nothing else on the burger (tomatoes, onions) made it any more flavorful. I would suggest that if you are going to serve a vegetarian burger at your restaurant that you at least try and include the vegetables you promised on your menu, and maybe try to have a little more imagination. But the disappointment sadly doesn't end there. My husband ordered the Harvest Burger, and says that it was also pretty boring, and so were the fries, which were a little too firm. He said he would rather have went to 5 guys or even Denny's. I guess when you open up a restaurant on a street that has dozens of places that serve 'diner food', especially burgers, you get a lot of picky people. 

Anyhow, this place just didn't stick out for us. It's really nothing special. However, I might give it another shot for breakfast some time.
This is a family owned restaurant that has a great menu, friendly staff, and reasonable prices.  The breakfast specials are on par with casino deals, and the food is MUCH better.  Give them a try!

We've been here for breakfast and lunch. The food is good, however the customer service needs some work. We asked for some extra napkins, and after watching our waiter walk pass us multiple times we helped ourselves to the stack near us. It also took a while to get our check once we were done eating and ready to go. Again, good food, but there's enough options around to go elsewhere.
Great breakfast specials! Breakfast Burrito was yummy & French toast combo :) me & my boyfriend enjoyed!

It was a good breakfast here at harvest. Very simple menu which included my choice of 2 eggs, bacon, and potatoes. The service was just ok. If your hungry you can eat here, but don't expect anything spectacular.
This little hole in the wall place has such great food. I love Eggs Benedict so I also gauge restaurants accordingly. The Benedict doesn't get any better than this.

Well gave this place another try. Yuck. Ordered  coffee and she brought out a carafe that hasn't seen a dishwasher in a month. None of the salt and pepper shakers and jam holders have either. I ordered a skillet for $10.29 and there was $5.00 worth of food on the plate. The GF ordered the eggs benidict and the sauce was out of a can or powder. Think I'm going to stay home and no be disappointed.  Haven't found a good breakfast place on the north side of town yet.

Stopped by on a rainy Sunday morning to get my weekend grub on... The other reviews are true - the decor is lacking. Nonexistent.  I had made my order via phone and it was ready exactly when they said it would be. The hostess was pleasant and prompt. The sausage burrito was hot, steamy, and arousing, BUT I couldn't taste it - the cheese, the eggs, the peppers, the meat. Pretty bland. Same goes for the hash browns. It wasn't bad, but I don't eat just to fill my belly. Pretty disappointed.

I also don't go to restaurants like this for the decor or service. It's all about the food. Two stars.

Stopped by another place a few minutes later and got their sausage breakfast burrito. I can taste this one...

Your friendly neighborhood cafe...well they were friendly when they finally decided to come around. I have to say, for a small cafe you'd think they were able to maintain the amount of seating in this place. Now I don't know what the deal was, but our server took awhile to greet us and take our order and after we got our food he never came back to check on us??? What the heck?!?! It was just me and my dad eating and we had ordered a simple breakfast. I don't even think my dad got a refill on his coffee. The food is priced fair for the quality of the food. It's nothing like Marilyn's but it's okay. I don't know if I really want to give this place another try, but my uncle seems to like it here, so maybe in the future I will.

Oh I had to ask for a take out container twice from two different people and I had to ask for the check which our server never brought. The first lady I asked went into the kitchen and would only peep her head out and then go back in...what the heck is that about?
